title: lazy_susan
body:
A Lazy Susan (a.k.a. Sally Wagon, or Dragon Sally, or Downtrodden Sally or Lazy Zan-Zu) is a turntable tray placed on a [[table]] or countertop to aid in distributing food. They are usually circular and placed in the center of a circular table to share dishes easily among diners. They are common at Chinese restaurants due to the culture of sharing dishes.

title: your_present_is_me
body: When a character presents themself to another as a [[gift]], usually on a traditional gift-giving occasion (e.g., Christmas, Valentine's Day, or the receiving character's birthday). Often involves [[naked ribbon]] and/or the presented character being [[in box|in a box]]. Valentine's Day versions also tend to involve [[chocolate on body]]. The receiving character doesn't necessarily need to be shown, and if shown, may or may not be pleased.

title: ranni_the_witch
body:
[b]Ranni the Witch[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is a mysterious figure who first introduces herself as Renna. Upon meeting her again, she reveals her true name and recruits the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] in servitude, setting them off in search of a hidden treasure. Her other servants are [[Blaidd the Half-Wolf]], [[War Counselor Iji]], [[Preceptor Seluvis]], and [[Glintstone Dragon Adula]]. She is the [[family|daughter]] of [[rennala queen of the full moon|Rennala]] and [[radagon of the golden order|Radagon]].

Ranni wears a [[large hat|large]] [[witch hat]] with wiry, silver [[hat ornament|ornamentation]] resembling a [[wreath]], and a [[fur cloak]] or [[fur cape|cape]] over what appears to be a pale [[robe]] or [[dress]]. She has [[extra arms|four arms]] and her limbs are [[doll joints|visibly jointed]]. She has [[cracked_skin|cracks]] on the left side of her face. She also has a second, translucent [[extra faces|face]] (called her "spirit face") which is displaced to one side, such that its left eye overlaps with her physical face's right eye. It is rather subtle and many players and artists don't notice it at first.

She normally wears a plain, silver [[ring]] on the ring finger of one of her right hands.

h4. See also

* [[Miniature Ranni]]
* [spoilers][[Lunar Princess Ranni]][/spoilers]

title: mid-autumn_festival
body:
The Mid-Autumn Festival (simplified Chinese: 中秋节; traditional Chinese: 中秋節), also known as Moon Festival or Mooncake Festival, is a traditional Chinese festival celebrated by China and many East and Southeast Asian people under the influence of China. It is the second-most important holiday after Chinese New Year with a history dating back over 3,000 years, when the Emperor of China worshipped the moon for bountiful harvests.

h4. See also

* [[Chuseok]] [tn]Korean equivalent[/tn]
* [[Tsukimi]] [tn]Japanese equivalent[/tn]

title: fusuma
body:
[b]Fusuma[/b] is a type of sliding panel in traditional [[east asian architecture|Japanese architecture]]. Unlike [[shouji]], they are fully opaque and do not have a visible wooden lattice. They usually have a circular handle, and can be either plain or decorated with [[tag group:image composition|traditional Japanese imagery and patterns.]]

title: ichigo_hitofuri
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character, designed by [[Kanameyura]]. The personification of the [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]] "[i]Ichigo Hitofuri[/i]":http://meitou.info/index.php/一期一振. He is the older brother of the Awataguchi school swords, due to the fact that he was the only tachi ever forged by Awataguchi.

Originally named "Okatana Yoshimitsu" (御刀吉光), Ichigo Hitofuri once belonged to Toyotomi Hideyoshi. He ordered the blade to be shortened to match his rather short height. Ichigo Hitofuri was damaged in the summer of 1615 during the Siege of Osaka at Osaka Castle and then re-tempered by Yasutsugu under the order of Tokugawa Ieyasu. However, Ieyasu didn’t had the chance to use this sword because he was advised by the Priest Tenkai to avoid sending Hideyoshi’s swords (including Ichigo Hitofuri) to Edo. It has been an Imperial treasure since that time, alongside [[Tsurumaru Kuninaga]], [[Uguisumaru]] and [[Hirano Toushirou]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[aqua hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. He wears [[white gloves]] and a [[military uniform]] with [[necktie]].

Ichigo has a polite and humble personality and is shown to be concerned with his brothers' well-being. However, it seems that he keeps things to himself, such as the fact that he's worried about losing his identity (since he was retempered in the past) and is secretly displeased about the Saniwa having so many swords. 

Fans enjoy portraying him as the big brother of the Awataguchi tantous, due to him being the biggest/tallest blade among Yoshimitsu's creations, not because he's the oldest among them. Either that, or he's presented as a foil to the prankster Tsurumaru.

Because of his in-game elder brother status, many of the swords tend to call him "Ichi-nii" (Big brother Ichi), which extends to his nickname outside the game as well.

title: shinano_toushirou
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. The personification of the [[tantou]] "Shinano Toushirou" and one of the many tantous of the Awataguchi school swords.

He was named after its owner Nagai Naomasa, whose title was Shinano no Kami, one of Tokugawa Ieyasu's retainers. Before that, it was owned by Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

He has short [[red hair]] and [[green eyes]]. He wears [[black gloves]] and a [[military uniform]] with [[necktie]], [[shorts]] and [[thigh holster|thigh holsters]].

A haughty and spoiled child, Shinano prides himself of being a "treasured sword" and thinks himself to be superior to the rest of the Toushirou brothers. He often demands for the [[saniwa_(touken_ranbu)|Saniwa]]'s attention, asking for attention and/or physical contact. His catchphrase is "懐入っていい？ ([[futokoro haitte ii?|Can I stay close to you?]])". Because it literally has the meaning of "Can I be in your bosom?", it is sometimes jokingly referred to as a sexually suggestive phrase.

After his Kiwame remodel, [spoiler]he isn't recognized by his former masters, but gets to reunite with the Sakai clan again. It helps Shinano realize, however, that he took the kindness of his current family and Saniwa for granted. When he returns, he's still as spoiled and clingy as before, but he stops acting like an entitled kid.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Kobayashi Yuusuke]]. Artist is [[Kunimitsu (9nimi2)|]].

title: surprised_pikachu_(meme)
body:

In the autumn of 2018, the image was used as a reaction image paired with captions where a set-up leads to a predictable outcome that nevertheless leaves one surprised.

Surprised Pikachu automatically gives an example of :o

title: what
body:
"[i]What.[/i]":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlatWhat

Posts that you do not understand at all and leave you thinking, "What the hell?" This tag is for things that transcend fetishes and leave [i]everyone[/i] stupefied.  Often if not always with some degree of surrealism.

Very [b][[tag_group:subjective|subjective]][/b] tag. [b]DO NOT[/b] flood this tag or apply it to random [[guro]]/[[bondage]] posts.

[quote]User [b]Hillside Moose[/b]: 
"Does it make your brain shut down for a minute the moment you see it?"
[/quote]


h6. List of Japanese equivalents of "what" tag on Pixiv

* "作者は病気":http://www.pixiv.net/tags.php?tag=%E4%BD%9C%E8%80%85%E3%81%AF%E7%97%85%E6%B0%97 (The artist is (mentally) ill) (Pixpedia article is "here":[http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/Author+is+Sick])

title: vorago
body:
Gigantic, rocky group boss monster in [i][[RuneScape]][/i]. Its name comes from the Latin word for "abyss". It's actually friendly, but can be challenged to an extremely difficult fight.

He is immortal and can only be stopped by a hammer forged from the weapon fragments embedded in him (wielded by [[hakurei reimu|Reimu]] in post #2287712. But even if defeated this way, he will still reform.

h4. See also

title: j7w_shinden
body:
The [b]Kyushu J7W Shinden[/b] (震電, "Magnificent Lightning") was a land-based interceptor developed during [[World War II]] by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] to defend against bombing raids by the [[B-29 Superfortress]]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #990309.[/tn]

Only two prototypes were built and the first flight was not until August 3, 1945, less than two weeks before the Japanese surrender. One of the the prototypes was scrapped after the war and the other is preserved in the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.

Despite having played no role in the war, the Shinden's distinctive appearance (with a rear-mounted "pusher" propeller, rear-mounted wings and [[canards]]) and the fact that it was Imperial Japan's most technologically advanced piston aircraft have given it an enduring popularity.

h4. See also
* [[List of airplanes]]
* "Wikipedia: Kyushu J7W":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyushu_J7W_Shinden]
* Kancolle Wiki: "Shinden (Magnificent Lightning) Kai":http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Shinden_%28Magnificent_Lightning%29_Kai (a fictional carrier-based variant)
** [[Shinden (Kancolle)]] (its [[fairy (kancolle)|]] pilot)

title: gaybar_pose_(meme)
body:
Famous attack move done by [[Danny Lee]] in original [[Gachimuchi]] videos. In this scene, Danny grabs both of [[Billy Herrington]]'s arms, pressing one of his knees on Billy's back, stretching his arms and shouts [b]"Give up!"[/b], which was widely misheard as "Gaybar".

This pose went viral in Japanese communities along with Gachimuchi communities which later spread outside Japan.

title: hizamaru_(touken_ranbu)
body:
Personification of the [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]] ''Usu-midori'', treasure of the Minamoto Clan. The name used for [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] is one of many that the sword had obtained over the years, ''Hizamaru'' in particular referencing a practice test where the sword cut through the knees of an opponent. 

The game portrays him as the younger brother/ younger brother figure of fellow Minamoto clan sword [[higekiri_(touken_ranbu)|Higekiri]], and is highly affectionate towards him though the historical Higekiri was used to cut Usu-midori (thus earning the name ''Tomokiri'', "Friend Cutter"). This is because of the relationship between their owners; Hizamaru's owner Minamoto no Yoshitsune had his brother Yoritomo, owner of Higekiri, in high regard. He also frets about becoming "separated" from his brother again, as seen in his citadel, pre-battle quote and sword breaking dialogue.

Has [[green hair]] swept over [[hair_over_one_eye| to the right side]] and [[yellow eyes]], and wears a [[military uniform]] with [[black gloves]]. He also has rather prominent [[fangs]] when he opens his mouth.


Shares a character designer with Higekiri in [[shirano]].

title: higekiri_(touken_ranbu)
body:
A [[tachi (weapon)|Tachi-class sword]]. Treasure of the Minamoto/Genji Clan, obtaining its name from a  test beheading where the sword cleanly cut through a criminal's beard along with the neck. Currently stored in Kitano Tenmangu Temple in Kyoto. 

In [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i], the sword is treated as the elder brother of [[hizamaru_(touken_ranbu)|Hizamaru]], another Minamoto clan Sword, though he's constantly forgetting Hizamaru's name. This may be a reference to the fact that both Hizamaru and Higekiri have had many different names throughout history. Fan works like to exaggerate this trait to the point of being a running gag, as Higekiri is bad with other names, as well.

He's portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[yellow eyes]], and wears a white jacket [[jacket_on_shoulders|around his shoulders]]. Has black [[half gloves]].

[i]Seiyuu[/i] is [[Hanae Natsuki]]. Character designer is [[shirano]].

title: saya_(scabbard)
body:

h5. Components
* [[Koiguchi]]: the mouth of the scabbard or its fitting
* [[Kojiri]]: scabbard's end cap, chape
* [[Kurigata]]: knob on the side of the scabbard for attaching the sageo
* [[Sageo]]: cord, passed through the kurigata for tying the scabbard to the belt

title: bob_ross
body:
[b]Bob Norman Ross[/b] (October 29, 1942 – July 4, 1995) was an American painter and television host who died of lymphoma at the age of 52.

With his calm, patient nature, Ross came to prominence as the creator and host of [i]The Joy of Painting[/i], a long-running television program on public broadcast stations in the United States. His [[afro]] styled hair was a delight to many fans.

title: steve_irwin
body:
[b]Stephen Robert Irwin[/b] (22 February 1962 – 4 September 2006), nicknamed the "Crocodile Hunter" was an Australian zookeeper and television personality.

Irwin became prominent as the titular host of the 1996 wildlife television series "[i]The Crocodile Hunter[/i]."

Irwin died in Batt Reef on September 2006 after being repeatedly stabbed by a [[stingray|smooth stingray]] in the chest, resulting in his heart being pierced by the stingray's barb. Irwin was supposed to be filming for his final documentary [i]Ocean's Deadliest[/i].

h4.External links
"Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Irwin]

title: roland_tr-808
body: The [b]Roland TR-808 Rhythm Composer[/b] is an analog synthesis [[drum machine]] manufactured by Roland Corporation. Though only in production from 1980 to 1983 an considered a commercial failure by its manufacturer, the TR-808 achieved a cult following and became the iconic drum machine of the later 1980s and beyond, particularly in the electronica and hip-hop genres.

title: gee_bill!_(meme)
body:
Parody images of the [i]Skinless[/i] hotdogs advertisement, published in September of 1942 from [i]Woman's Day[/i] magazine.

Depicts two characters, one with one thing, and the other with two of that thing. The former asking the latter something similar to "Gee [x]! How come [y] lets you have [u]two[/u] [z]s?"

title: fumi-chan_(tawawa)
body: The pet cat of [[senpai (tawawa)|Senpai]] from [[Getsuyoubi no Tawawa]], first appearing in the anime adaptation before eventually making its debut in the Twitter webcomic. It was given its name by [[kouhai-chan (tawawa)|Kouhai-chan]], because when she first picked it up, it kneaded (in Japanese: 踏み踏みしてきた, or [i]fumifumi-shitekita[/i]) her breasts.

title: diablo_(isekai_maou)
body:
The main protagonist of [i][[Isekai Maou to Shoukan Shoujo no Dorei Majutsu]][/i].

In his previous life, he is known as [b]Takuma Sakamoto[/b], also known by his username of "[nodtext]@Diablo-13[/nodtext]". Later on, Takuma became the very character he was playing in an MMORPG named "Cross Reverie" after reincarnating in the video game's world.

Portrayed as a highly confident, insolent demon lord with charismatic aura, but in truth, is an introvert and rather nervous man.

title: nurburgring

title: doushite-chan
body:
A character appearing in many of [[Pinocchio-P]]'s music videos.
Like [[Aimaina]], she's a [[chibi]] version (or perhaps a hand puppet?) of [[Hatsune Miku]], only this time with [[pink hair]], blood trailing from her mouth, and [[black eyes]].

Is usually seen bloody or holding a knife.

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: souffle_pancake
body:
A Japanese [[pancake]] variant, characterized by being much thicker, fluffier and airier. They’re made using the same ingredients as regular pancakes, but with less flour, with the egg whites beaten into a meringue and using a folding technique just like [[souffle (food)| souffle]], hence the name. They can be made in a mold, which results in a [[cake]]-like shape and more compressed structure.

h4. See also

* [[pancake stack]] 
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: control_bar
body:
Typically depicted as a wooden cross, used to control the puppet strings attached to a marionette.

h4. See also
* [[marionette]]
* [[puppet]]
* [[puppet rings]]
* [[puppet strings]]

title: puppet_rings
body:
[[Ring]]s used to control and manipulate [[puppet]]s.

Typically drawn as one or more (but most commonly, a full set) of metal bands or rings on a person's fingers. [[Puppet strings]] are often attached to these rings, but not always directly or visibly. 

These may also appear [i]as[/i] or [i]in conjunction with[/i] [[fingerless gloves]] (post #1127458, for example), but still qualify for this tag.

Most commonly appears in images featuring [[Alice Margatroid]].

h4. See also
* [[control bar]]
* [[puppet strings]]
* [[Shanghai doll]]

Her alternate development name was Rachel Speyer (レイチェル・スパイヤー).

title: hiroshima_peace_memorial
body: Hiroshima Peace Memorial, commonly called the Atomic Bomb Dome or A-Bomb Dome (原爆ドーム Genbaku Dōmu), in [[Hiroshima]], Japan, is part of the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1996. The ruin serves as a memorial to the people who were killed in the [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|atomic bombing of Hiroshima]] on August 6, 1945.

title: hokuto_ujou_koushou_ha
body:
Lit. North Star Humanist Rising Bird Wave 

The power-up version of [[toki_(hokuto_no_ken)|Toki]]'s [[Hokuto Ujou Hagan Ken]], appeared in Koei's [[Hokuto Musou]], aka. Fist of the North Star: Ken's Rage. 

Due to its strong similarity with [[Wing Gundam Zero]]'s beam attack in the [[Super Robot Wars]] series, it is frequently called [b]Hokuto Ujou Rolling Buster Rifle[/b]. 

h4.See also 

* [[Hokuto Ujou Hagan Ken]] 
* [[Hokuto Musou]]

https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Fish-Flavored_Toast

body: The Vision of Archons, looks like chess pieces

title: waverider_(genshin_impact)
body:
A watercraft in [[genshin_impact|Genshin Impact]].

A small [[boat]] the player can use to navigate bodies of water. It has an interior cabin, a [[lantern]] hanging from its back to the side, and three small flags are hung from the back of the cabin. The roof of the boat's cabin is mostly white with some gold patterns.

title: sanae-chan
body:
[i]A friend of Rie-chan.
She sings very well, and often goes to sing karaoke with her on her off days.
She's been taking guitar classes lately![/i]

A Japanese girl who is a friend of [[Rie-chan]]. They work in the same [[cafe]] together. She used to work in a general goods where she earned enough money to buy a [[guitar]]. Now she takes guitar lessons from Sugi-kun; she also takes [[knitting]] lessons from Oliva. 

Hates smokers and tobacco in general.

title: pizza_hut
body:
A popular American franchise of [[pizza]] restaurants. The franchise was founded on 1958 by the Carney brothers, Dan Carney and his late younger brother, Frank Carney.

It was prominently featured in the anime [i][[Code Geass]][/i] as part of [[product placement]] and in [i][[Genshin Impact]][/i] during a collaboration event in the China branch.

h4. See also

* [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]]
* [[Code Geass]]
* [[Cheese-kun]]

title: ceiling_fan
body: A fan suspended from or mounted directly to the [[ceiling]]. Ceiling fans are almost always powered by electric motors, but images of ceiling fans shouldn't be tagged [[electric fan]] unless there is a corded or battery-powered fan present.

title: three_as_one
body: [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] song '"Three of Me, One of Someone Else":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dxKr446vMXM]' by Shiro Sagisu, referring to [[Ayanami Rei]]'s three incarnations from the original anime continuation, known as 'Rei I', 'Rei II' and 'Rei III', [spoiler]and Rei's being a clone of [[Ikari Yui]],[/spoiler] while also referencing Eric Berne's transactional analysis and the PAC ego-states of Parent, Adult (self) and Child.

title: dead_sea_scrolls
body: Ancient Jewish and Hebrew religious manuscripts discovered between 1946 and 1956, including the oldest surviving manuscripts of some parts of [[the Bible|the Tanakh]].

title: tamaki_(mechanic)_(princess_connect!)
body:
[[Tamaki (princess connect!)|]]'s [[official alternate costume|official]] mechanic costume in [[Princess Connect!]].

She is a [[catgirl]] who has [[purple eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[gradient hair]] that is [[purple hair|purple]] (sometimes [[pink hair|pink]] & [[white hair|white]] with [[bangs]]. As well as [[cat ears]] with [[animal ear fluff]] & [[two tails|two]] [[cat tail]]s. She wears a [[purple shirt|purple]] [[crop top]], [[purple skirt|purple]] [[miniskirt]], a [[black choker]] with a [[neck bell ]], [[purple headwear|purple]] [[visor cap]], [[utility belt]], [[backpack]], and a [[megaphone]], and an [[armlet]].

h4. See Also

* "Mechanic Tamaki":[https://princess-connect.fandom.com/wiki/Tamaki_(Mechanic)]

title: natsuzora
body:
"Natsuzora":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natsuzora] (なつぞら) is a Japanese television drama series aired in 2019 as part of Asadora (朝ドラ, "Morning Drama") TV block on NHK. All of the asadora storylines center on the life of a female heroine who faces challenges while working to achieve her dreams. Natsuzora is loosely based on the life of animator "Reiko Okuyama":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Okuyama].

The story is set during the high economic development time of the Showa period. [[okuhara_natsu|Natsu]] lost her parents during the war so she moves to the Tokachi region in Hokkaido with her foster father who is a dairy farmer. While growing up, Natsu meets a boy at primary school who draws a very beautiful picture of a horse so she becomes interested in animated movies. Upon graduating from senior high school, Natsu moves to Tokyo and joins the budding animation industry in order to fulfill her dream of becoming an animator.

title: nitori_day
body:
February 10th is [[Kawashiro Nitori]] Day, one of [[Touhou|Touhou Project]] date tags. Since February 10th can be read as "2 (ni) 10 (to)" it's a day when artists draw and post artworks with Nitori.

For those who missed February 10th, there is also a tag called "February 11th is the day for those who missed Nitori Day."
other_names: 2月11日はにとりの日に間に合わなかった人の日

title: mahou_yuugi
body: Magical Play (魔法遊戯 飛び出す!! ハナマル大冒険, Mahō Yūgi Tobidasu!! Hanamaru Daibōken) is a Japanese original net animation directed by Hiroki Hayashi featuring character designs by Kiyohiko Azuma. It was webcast from November 16, 2001 to May 3, 2002, totaling twenty-four episodes. The magical girl satire was later compiled into four half-hour episodes and released on four DVDs. A 3D OVA episode was released on December 29, 2001
other_names: 魔法遊戯飛び出す!!ハナマル大冒険

title: futaba_anzu
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. A lazy, short (139 cm or 4'7"), 17-year-old [[NEET]], she often wears a white [[t-shirt]] with "[[you work you lose|You Lose If You Work]]" on the front and can be seen with a tattered [[stuffed rabbit]].

She believes she will be able to become rich and live off her earnings as an idol. Her aloof and uncooperative attitude remains unchanged even after training. 

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the first CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Shibuya Rin]], [[Mimura Kanako]], [[Takagaki Kaede]] and [[Jougasaki Rika]]. Her seiyuu is [[Igarashi Hiromi]].

She is in the unit "Ankira" with [[Moroboshi Kirari]], as well as "[[CANDY ISLAND (idolmaster)|]]" with [[Mimura Kanako]] and [[Ogata Chieri]].

title: jackie_chan
body:
Hong Kong's cheeky, lovable and best known film star, Jackie Chan endured many years of long, hard work and multiple injuries to establish international success via his early beginnings in Hong Kong's manic [[martial arts]] cinema industry.

Jackie was born Kong-sang Chan on Hong Kong's famous Victoria Peak on April 7, 1954, to Charles and Lee-Lee Chan, and the family emigrated to Canberra, Australia, in early 1960. The young Jackie was less than successful scholastically, so his father sent him back to Hong Kong to attend the rigorous China Drama Academy, one of the Peking Opera schools.
(Source: Imdb.com)

h4. See also
* [[Jet Li]]
* [[Bruce Lee]]
* [[Jackie Chan Adventures]]

title: li_wenwen
body:

title: sun_yiwen
body:
A Chinese women's left-handed [[epee|épée]] [[fencing|fencer]]. She is a two-time Olympian, she is a [[2016 summer olympics|2016]] team Olympic silver medalist, 2016 individual Olympic bronze medalist, and [[2020 summer olympics|2021]] individual Olympic champion. In Tokyo, She became the first Chinese fencer in history to win an Olympic gold medal in individual women's épée.

title: katalina_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Katalina Aryze (カタリナ・アリゼ [i]Katarina Arize[/i]) is a playable SR [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i] character.

She is one of the main characters and is the first character to be attained by the player.

She has long brown hair and brown eyes (though her sprite depicts her eyes as red). She wears earrings and standard silver and blue armour along with a cape and many [[belt skirt]]s. Catalina herself is very righteous and the sworn protector of [[lyria (granblue fantasy)|Lyria]].

title: the_dirty_pair_(comic)
body: An officially licensed manga-style American comic series based on the [[Dirty Pair]] franchise. It is comprised of several short miniseries, each released as a collected volume. The entire series is illustrated by [[Adam Warren]].

title: dirty_pair
body:
A [[science fiction]] franchise based on a series of novels by Takachiho Haruka. The series follows [[Kei (dirty pair)|]] and [[Yuri (dirty pair)|]], a pair of WWWA agents who solve crimes and complete various other jobs they are given while causing massive collateral damage along the way. The franchise has multiple different entries, many of which are in separate continuities.

The most recognizable version of the main duo is from the 80s anime adaptation, where they were designed by [[Dokite Tsukasa]] and featured in a TV series, an OVA series, a theatrical film, and several OVA films.

h4. Other Versions
* [[Dirty Pair (novels)|The novels]], the source material for the franchise, illustrated by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]].
* [[Dirty Pair Flash]], a 90s reboot featuring a younger version of the pair in a new continuity with character designs by [[Kimura Takahiro]].
* [[Dirty Pair no Daibouken]], a 2012 manga that shares its name with the first volume of the original novels, illustrated by [[Tamaki Hisao]].
* [[The Dirty Pair (comic)|]], a series of officially licensed comics published by Eclipse Comics and Dark Horse Comics, written and illustrated by [[Adam Warren]].


h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirty_Pair]
* "Wikipedia (JP)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%80%E3%83%BC%E3%83%86%E3%82%A3%E3%83%9A%E3%82%A2]

title: mobius_1
body:
"Amidst the blue skies, a link from past to future. The sheltering wings of the protector... The flames of hatred scorched the skies... Igniting Gaia's funeral pyre."

Protagonist and player character of the game [[Ace Combat 04]]. Lead pilot of the Mobius squadron, part of the [[isaf|I.S.A.F.]] Air Force, and flies an [[F-22 Raptor]].

Not much is known about the past or future of Mobius 1. Throughout the game he seems to be the only member of his squadron, alongside his AWACS codenamed Sky Eye, which doesn't seem to faze him at all as he nearly singlehandedly puts Erusea to their knees with an almost inhuman combat performance. 

[spoiler]However his surviving allies from previous missions join the squadron for the final mission against the Megalith facility.[/spoiler]

The callsign "Mobius" comes from the [[mobius strip]], a 3-dimensional shape which only has one side. It is commonly referred to the real-world representation of the word "infinity."
A möbius strip makes up the major part of the squadron insignia (post #717018).

In 2023, the Chinese Balloon incident suddenly became a trend and referenced the 13th Mission known as "Safe Return" where Mobius 1 shot down the Jamming Airships throughout the mountains while escorting a spy plane.

h4.See also

* "Acepedia article":http://acecombat.wikia.com/wiki/Mobius_1
* [[Ace Combat 04]]
* [[Yellow 4]]

title: berserk_ryuuko
body: First appearing in Episode 12 of [[Kill la Kill]], it is a monstrous form that Ryuuko and Senketsu mutate into during their fight against [[Harime Nui]], caused by Ryuuko's blood boiling to an unsafe level from sheer rage. This form is most notable for its warped, zombified twist on Ryuuko's normal appearance: [[Scissor Blade (kill La Kill)|]] half-attached to the right arm; a gigantic, armored, bloody left arm; Senketsu's eye constricted and bloodshot; boiling blood spouting randomly; and a pair of huge, sharp maws on the head and waist. Both Senketsu and Ryuuko also seem to groan from constant pain caused by this transformation.

title: scissor_blade_(kill_la_kill)
body:
[[Matoi Ryuuko]]'s primary weapon in [[Kill la Kill]]. She wields one half of a red pair of scissors capable of cutting apart Goku Uniforms. The Scissor Blade can shrink into a regular-sized scissor half, or morph itself via mechanical joints into a much larger version that Ryuuko uses to fight, which she calls Decapitation Mode.

The other half is with the person responsible for murdering Ryuuko's father. She battles [[Kiryuuin Satsuki]] and her minions to find out who owns the missing Scissor Blade.

[spoiler]In episode 12, [[Harime Nui]] reveals that she owns the other half of the Scissor Blade and that she murdered Ryuuko's father on [[Kiryuuin Ragyou]]'s orders. For some reason, Nui's half is colored purple until Ryuuko recovers it and reattaches it to her own half.[/spoiler]

title: ferrari_f40
body: The [b]Ferrari F40[/b] is an Italian sports car introduced in 1987 to celebrate Ferrari's 40th anniversary--even though the company was founded in 1939. The F40 was very expensive by the standards of the day ($400,000 MSRP in the US) and was one of the main competitors to the [[Lamborghini Countach]]. It also has the distinction of being the last car personally approved by company founder Enzo Ferrari before his death in 1988. Road-legal F40s were made from 1987 to 1992, with racing-only versions persisting until 1996.

title: ju_87
body:
A [[World War II|World War II]] dive [[bomber]] made by German manufacturer Junkers & Co. It was first used by the [i]Luftwaffe[/i] in 1936 and continued in service until 1943-44, operating throughout Europe, Africa, and the Mediterranean. Recognition features include an inverted "gull wing":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gull_wing, fixed landing gear with wheel fairings, three-bladed [[propeller]] and undernose air intake, braced tailplanes, and long 'greenhouse' canopy topped by a radio antenna. 

The [b]Junkers Ju-87 "Stuka"[/b] was crewed by a pilot and gunner/radio operator. Armament included 2 forward-firing [[machine gun|machine guns]] for the pilot and a single 7.92mm machine gun for the gunner. The Stuka could also carry various bomb loads underwing or a pair of podded tank-busting [[cannon]]. It also carried sirens (called "Jericho Trumpets") on its landing gear to serve as psychological warfare weapons, although those were later removed in later variants because they helped enemy pilots to detect and identify the planes.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stuka
* "Youtube: All You Need To Know About The Stuka Dive Bomber":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9PzfGAZvT5M&feature=fvw

title: me_262
body:
The [b]Messerschmitt Me-262[/b] was one of the very first combat capable [[jet]] fighter planes in the history of world aviation. 

This pioneering twin-engine aircraft entered service with the [[Luftwaffe]] (German air force) in mid-1944 and was used effectively in several roles during [[ww_ii|World War II]]. 

While the plane proved effective against bomber pilots who have never encountered jet aircraft before, it was deployed too late into the war. The plane is also a maintenance nightmare, due to the fact that its Jumo 002 engines have very limited lifespan of 21 hours of usage and causing a strain on Germany's lack of supply. Furthermore, contary to popular belief, the Allied powers have also deployed their jet aircraft into the European theatre (most notably [[P-80 Shooting Star]] and [[Gloster Meteor]]) during the early 1944, which means that the plane will not affect the course of the war regardless of how early it was deployed.

h4.See Also
* [[Ki-201 karyuu]]
* [[kikka (airplane)]]
* [[list of airplanes]]

h4.External Links
* "Wikipedia: Messerschmitt Me 262":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messerschmitt_Me_262

title: p-38_lightning
body:
American [[World War II]] twin-engined piston fighter. Designed at the outset by Lockheed to answer a US Army Air Forces proposal for a high-altitude interceptor, it was also later used in ground attack and reconnaissance roles.

It is easily recognizable by its twin-boom, twin-engined construction. Armament included a 20mm cannon, .50-caliber [[machine gun|machine guns]], rockets, and bombs. Additional payloads included drop tanks and camera packs. One rather odd light bomber variant replaced all the guns with a second crewman operating a bombsight.

Due to its unparalelled speed and ease of control compared to its contempolaries during the early stage of the war, it has garnered a reputation amongst Axis pilots. German pilots who flew against the P-38 nicknamed it "Der Gabelschwanz Teufel" ("The Fork-Tailed Devil"), while the Japanese called it "Two planes, one pilot".

title: pythagoras_trio
body:
[[Pythagoras Trio]] is a 3-person sub-unit consisting of [[Nikaido Yamato]], [[Izumi Mitsuki]], and [[Rokuya Nagi]] from [[IDOLiSH7 (idolish7)|]].

During the joint practice portion of the Main Story between [[IDOLiSH7 (idolish7)|]] and [[TRIGGER (idolish7)|]] (around Part 2 - Chapter 9) [[Kujou Tenn]] from [[TRIGGER (idolish7)|]] is added to the group for this period.

Pythagoras Trio's unit name comes from the Pythagorean Tuning, which is made up of sharps, flats, and naturals, which are [[Nikaido Yamato]] (Sharp), [[Izumi Mitsuki]] (Flat), and [[Rokuya Nagi]] (Natural) respective musical symbols.

title: double_dragon
body:
[b]Double Dragon[/b] is an action video game franchise that originated with the titular first game in the series in 1987. The original game was a beat 'em up [[video game]] conceived by "Kishimoto Yoshihisa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshihisa_Kishimoto (creator of the [[Kunio-kun series]]) and developed by "Technōs Japan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Techn%C5%8Ds_Japan . It was distributed in North America and Europe by [[Taito]] Corporation. 

The game was a spiritual and technological successor to Technos' earlier beat 'em up, [[Nekketsu Kouha Kunio-kun]] (released outside of Japan by Taito as [i]Renegade[/i]), but introduced several additions such as two-player cooperative gameplay and the ability to arm oneself with an enemy's weapon after disarming them. Double Dragon is considered to be one of the first successful examples of the genre, resulting in the creation of two arcade sequels and several spinoffs, as well as inspiring other companies in creating their own beat 'em ups.

Home versions of the game were released for the [[NES]], [[Sega Master System]], Atari 2600, Atari 7800, Atari ST, Amiga, Commodore 64, Game Boy, [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Sega Genesis and Atari Lynx, among other platforms during the series's height of popularity. A remake titled Double Dragon Advance was released for the Game Boy Advance in 2003. The NES version was re-released for the Wii's Virtual Console in North America on April 28, 2008 at a cost of 500 Wii Points. Nintendo also released the Game Boy version on the Nintendo 3DS Virtual Console in 2011.

Another remake was released for the iOS mobile devices in 2011, which features brand new gameplay, sprites, animations and music. 

Several sequels of the original game have been produced during the years for the arcade and different home consoles. A competitive fighting version was produced for the [[Neo Geo]] game console during the 90s.

A new Double Dragon title, [[Double Dragon Neon]], was released in 2012 for Xbox Live Arcade and PlayStation Network, and is considered a reboot of the series.

To celebrate the franchise's 30th anniversary, Arc System Works released Double Dragon IV in 2017. It takes place shortly after Double Dragon II and uses an 8-bit artstyle.

h4. See also

* [[Jimmy Lee]]
* [[Billy Lee]]
* [[Marian Kelly]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Double Dragon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double_Dragon

title: gaia_(mythology)
body:
In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Gaia[/b] is the titan goddess of the earth, life, and the matriach of the Greek pantheon.

In the Greek creation myth, Gaia was born from Chaos, an entity of nothingness, and later created her sprouse Ouranos, the titan god of the sky, to give birth to the twelve titan gods. After the titan gods revolt against Ouranos' rule and rule the pantheon, they were subsequently detroned by [[Zeus (mythology)|]] and his siblings during the Titanomachy, creating the "current" pantheon. Due to her essential power in keeping the earth inact, Gaia were spared from both revolts.

title: artemis_(mythology)
body: In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Artemis[/b] is the goddess of the hunt, the wild, wild animals, the moon, and chastity. Daughter of [[Zeus (mythology)|]] and Leto, and twin sister of [[Apollo (mythology)|]]. Patron protector of young girls, and was worshipped as a goddess of childbirth. While she had sworn to never marry, as per her domain, she attracted the attention of many men. However, only the hunter Orion had won her heart, a love that would end with his death, either unknowingly by Artemis' hands or by the stinger of a scorpion.

title: hades_(mythology)
body:
In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Hades[/b] is the god of the underworld and one of the three major gods, alongsides his younger brother [[Poseidon (mythology)|]] and [[Zeus (mythology)|]]. His realm is Tartarus, a realm where the dead resided in the afterlife.

Due to his association with the underworld (often misinterpretated as [[hell]]), Hades is usually protrayed as an evil character in popular culture. Albeit his mythological counterpart usually prefer to distance himself from the chaos of the Olympian gods and mostly resides within his realm. With a notable exception being when he kidnapped his future wife [[Persephone (mythology)|]] into the underworld.

title: centurion_(juuouki)
body:
Playable character and main protagonist of the [i][b][[Juuouki]][/b][/i] 1988 beat'em up action and [[fantasy]] arcade [[video game]] developed and manufactured by [[SEGA]].

He is a deceased Roman Centurion who is resurrected by [[Zeus (mythology)|]] to rescue Zeus' daughter Athena by fighting undead monsters using the magical ability to transform into several beasts.

title: thanatos_(mythology)
body:
In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Thanatos[/b] is the god of death and mortality.

One of the original twelve titan gods, Thanatos is among the most powerful god in the mythology due to his ability to turn any god into a mere mortal. Due to this, Thanatos were one of the few titans who were left untouched by the revolt of [[Zeus (mythology)|]] and his siblings against Cronus. After Zeus came to power, he became an aide of [[Hades (mythology)|]] and has given a role to end the life of any mortal beings when their life cycle ends.

title: apollo_(mythology)
body:
[b]Apollo[/b] (Attic, Ionic, and Homeric Greek: Ἀπόλλων, Apollōn (gen.: Ἀπόλλωνος); Doric: Ἀπέλλων, Apellōn; Arcadocypriot: Ἀπείλων, Apeilōn; Aeolic: Ἄπλουν, Aploun; Latin: Apollō) is one of the most important and complex of the Olympian deities in ancient Greek and Roman religion, Greek and Roman mythology, and Greco–Roman Neopaganism. The ideal of the kouros (a beardless, athletic youth), Apollo has been variously recognized as the god of light and the [[sun]], truth and prophecy, healing, plague, music, poetry, and more. 

Apollo is the son of [[Zeus (mythology)|]] and Leto, and has a twin sister, the chaste huntress [[Artemis (mythology)|]]. Apollo is known in Greek-influenced Etruscan mythology as Apulu.

As the patron of Delphi ([[Pythia]]n Apollo), Apollo was an oracular god —the prophetic deity of the Delphic Oracle-. 

Medicine and healing are associated with Apollo, whether through the god himself or mediated through his son Asclepius, yet Apollo was also seen as a god who could bring ill-health and deadly plague. 

Amongst the god's custodial charges, Apollo became associated with dominion over colonists, and as the patron defender of herds and flocks. As the leader of the Muses (Apollon Musegetes) and director of their choir, Apollo functioned as the patron god of music and poetry. Hermes created the lyre for him, and the instrument became a common attribute of Apollo. Hymns sung to Apollo were called paeans.

title: prometheus_myth
body:
In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Prometheus[/b] (/prəˈmiːθiəs/; Ancient Greek: Προμηθεύς, [promɛːtʰéu̯s], possibly meaning "forethought") is a Titan god of fire, best known for defying the gods by stealing fire from them and giving it to humanity in the form of technology, knowledge, and more generally, civilization.

In some versions of the myth, he is also credited with the creation of humanity from clay. Prometheus is known for his intelligence and for being a champion of humankind, and is also generally seen as the author of the human arts and sciences.

The punishment of Prometheus as a consequence of the theft of fire and giving it to humans is a popular subject of both ancient and modern culture. [[Zeus (mythology)|]], king of the Olympian gods, sentenced Prometheus to eternal torment for his transgression. Prometheus was bound to a rock, and an eagle—the emblem of Zeus—was sent to eat his liver (in ancient Greece, the liver was thought to be the seat of human emotions).  His liver would then grow back overnight, only to be eaten again the next day in an ongoing infinite cycle. Prometheus was eventually freed by the hero [[Heracles (mythology)|]].

title: hera_(mythology)
body:
In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Hera[/b] is the goddess of women, marriage, family and childbirth in ancient Greek faith and myth, better known as the sister and the first wife of [[Zeus (mythology)|]]. She is the second eldest of the six children of Cronos and Rhea.

Ironically, despite these positive associations with relationships and family, Hera is defined by her vengeful and spiting nature towards the numerous women and illegitimate offspring of her Zeus, a notorious paramour.

title: zeus_(mythology)
body:
[b]Zeus[/b] is the king of the gods, the god of thunder, and the patriach of the [[Greek mythology|Greek pantheon]]. The youngest of the six children of titan Cronos and Rhea, Zeus led the revolt against his father and inprisoned him in Tautarus. Due to his leadership, Zeus' brothers and sisters appointed him as the leader of the Pantheon.

Notorious for his amorous personality, given the number of bastards he spawns with every female (and even some male) he fancied.

title: odysseus_(mythology)
body:
A hero from [[Greek Mythology]]. Also the name of a fictional [[spacecraft]].

[b]Odysseus[/b] is the legendary Greek king of [[Ithaca]] and a hero of Homer's epic adventure poem, [i]The Odyssey[/i].

In Roman Mythology his name was changed to "Ulysses", which is his Latin name.

Wife of [[Hephaestus (mythology)|]], winner of the apple of discord in the judgement of Paris when she offer the bribe of the most beautiful mortal in the world to him. title: side_arms_hyper_dyne
body:
[b]Hyper Dyne Side Arms[/b], also known as [b]Side Arms Hyper Dyne[/b] or simply as [b]Side Arms[/b], is a horizontally scrolling shooter developed and released by [[Capcom]] as an [[arcade]] [[video game]] in 1986. 

In this cooperative game each player takes control of one of two flying [[mecha]] suits ([[Mobilesuit Alpha]] and [[Mobilesuit Beta]]) and must battle an [[alien]] army. Side Arms uses a two-directional attacking system similar to Capcom's previous shoot-'em-up [[Section Z]].

title: abdominal_stretch
body:
Also known as a [[Cobra Twist]], this hold begins with a wrestler facing his opponent's side. The wrestler first straddles one of the opponent's legs, then reaches over the opponent's near arm with the arm close to the opponent's back and locks it. Squatting and twisting to the side, flexes the opponent's back and stretches their abdomen. 

This move can also be applied to a seated opponent.

title: nissan_skyline_v36
body:
The twelfth generation of the [[Nissan Skyline]], produced from 2006-2014.

Sold in America and several other foreign markets as an [[Infiniti (company)|]] model. First introduced as a continuation of the G35's run in 2007, it was later rebranded as the [[infiniti G37|G37]] in 2009. When the Japanese version ended production, the Infiniti models continued being sold as the Q40 sedan in 2014, while the coupe had been rebranded into the [[Infiniti Q60|Q60]] in 2013.

title: sony_c-800
body:
The Sony C800G is a high-end tube vocal microphone. The mic was made popular for pop and R&B production by users like Dr. Dre, Mariah Carey, R. Kelly, Kelly Clarkson and many others.

Sony’s C800G capsule is based on the Neumann K67 design. Both are large-diaphragm, dual-diaphragm, center-terminated capsules; the C800G capsule retains the K67’s characteristic backplate drilling pattern.

http://recordinghacks.com/microphones/Sony/C800G

title: nissan_skyline_c10
body:
The third generation of the [[Nissan Skyline]], and the first manufactured with the [[Nissan]] badge (the previous generations were sold by "Prince Motor Company":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Motor_Company] prior to their merger with Nissan). Also known as the 2000GT and 2400GT.

Produced from 1968 to 1972 and succeeded by the [[nissan skyline c110|C110]].

This was the first model in the lineup to have a [[Nissan Skyline GT-R|GT-R]] performance variant, which was introduced in 1969.

title: housei_my_friend
body:
A joke in [[Downtown no Gaki no Tsukai ya Arahende!!]]'s 2013 New Year's Eve Special: "Zettai ni Waratte wa Ikenai Chikyuu Boueigun 24ji (2013)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%B5%B6%E5%AF%BE%E3%81%AB%E7%AC%91%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A6%E3%81%AF%E3%81%84%E3%81%91%E3%81%AA%E3%81%84%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E9%98%B2%E8%A1%9B%E8%BB%8D24%E6%99%82].

Here's a good English explanation: comment #1225449.

Here's another one:

[quote]Reference to the 2013 instance of the annually recurring "Absolutely No Laughing" segment on the long-running TV show "Gaki no Tsukai":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downtown_no_Gaki_no_Tsukai_ya_Arahende!!], which was called "Absolutely No Laughing: Earth Defense Force". Part of the skit involved an alien being discovered in a cupboard, which suddenly decided to declare its eternal friendship with "Tsukitei Housei":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H%C5%8Dsei_Tsukitei by saying "HOUSEI MY FRIEND" (in English). Eventually this caused Housei to be branded as a traitor to Earth, when the alien invaded an Earth Defense Force base, was captured, and indicated that Housei was its friend. Full story "on ニコニコ大百科":[http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%83%9B%E3%82%A6%E3%82%BB%E3%82%A4%E3%83%9E%E3%82%A4%E3%83%95%E3%83%AC%E3%83%B3%E3%83%89], abbreviated video clip of the segment "on YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Jcps_TM7bc].[/quote]

title: pico_(newgrounds_series)
body:
A series of web animations and flash games on [[Newgrounds]], created by Tom Fulp with assistance from MindChamber and IvanAlmighty. Regarded as one of Newgrounds' flagship series.

h4. Official entries
* [i]Darnell Plays with Fire[/i]: An interactive short about Darnell, explaining to the viewer his pyromania as a city he set on fire is being destroyed in the background.
* [i]Nene Interactive Suicide:[/i] A short game covering Nene deciding how to kill herself after contracting Herpes the previous day.
* [i]Pico's School[/i]: The first officially titled game. Covers [[pico (newgrounds)|Pico]] stopping a group of goth and punk students from further destroying his school after a mass shooting.
* [i]Pico V.S. Bear[/i]: The second game focusing on Pico, covering his assassination of the criminals Big Brown Bary and the Big House that Blew, a [i][[Bear in the Big Blue House]][/i] parody. Part of the [i]Assassin[/i] series.
* [i]Pico Vs. Uberkids[/i]: A short game featuring Pico, Nene, and Darnell challenging a trio of clones to Rock-Paper-Scissors Roulette.
* [i]Resident Pico[/i]: A short game featuring Pico shooting down hordes of zombies.

h4. Unofficial entries
* [i][[Pico's Cousin]][/i]: A series of fan flash games about [[Otis (Pico's Cousin)|Otis]], a relative of Pico who has to deal with the fallout of his previous actions.
* [i]Pico's Unloaded[/i]: A short (later adapted into a top-down shooter by the same artist) where Pico mows down hundreds of Uberkids. Gives him his then-on signature gun, the [[imi Uzi|Uzi]].
* [i]Pico Vs. Convict[/i]: A short about Pico having to rescue Nene from Convict, a shapeshifter with the primary appearance of a prisoner.
* [i]Piconjo[/i]: The adventures of an unhinged character who solves his problems by causing chaos and "pwning" his opponents with his sword and odd biology. Originated as the avatar of a Newgrounds user known for spamming the website.
* [i]Pico 2[/i]: An unreleased but constantly teased game that would have had Pico explore more of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: shin-ah_(akatsuki_no_yona)
body:
A character from [[Akatsuki no Yona]].

Shin-Ah (シンア) is the current Seiryuu (Blue Dragon in english), one of the four Dragon Warriors and he possessed the blood of the blue dragon deity. His power lies in his eyes where he has the power to cause hallucinations and paralyze an opponent with his gaze.

title: jae-ha_(akatsuki_no_yona)
body:
A character from [[Akatsuki no Yona]].

Jae-Ha (ジェハ) is the current Ryokuryuu (Green Dragon in english), one of the four Dragon Warriors and he possesses the blood of the green dragon deity. His power lies within his right leg which gives him the ability to fly by jumping high and over long distances.

title: ik-su_(akatsuki_no_yona)
body:
A character from [[Akatsuki no Yona]].

[[Ik-Su (akatsuki no yona)|Ik-Soo]] (イクス) is the clumsy High Priest of the Kouka Kingdom and is [[Yoon (akatsuki no yona)|Yoon]]’s guardian. He spends his days in isolation as he prays to the gods for guidance and for the happiness of the people. He reveals a prophecy to [[Yona (akatsuki no yona)|]] that marks the start of her search for the four dragon warriors.

H4. External Links

title: race_bib
body:
A race bib is commonly used by athletes in sporting competitions and have numbers and/or the competitor's names on them to differentiate between them all. Race bibs can be sorted into 2 categories: 

* An adult sized bib that has straps going over the shoulders and around the waist
* A sticker or piece of paper that is stuck onto the front of a shirt
